Actions.Text: REFERRED TO CORPORATIONS, AUTHORITIES AND COMMISSIONS

Title: Relates to the finality of certain utility charges and the contents of utility bills
Summary: Prohibits utility corporations from charging customers for gas or electric service which was rendered more than three months of the monthly billing period; requires utility corporations to provide a thirteen-month usage history in their bills.
LawCode: Amd §§41, 66-w & 44, ren §41-a to be §66-w, Pub Serv L; amd §4, Chap of 2023 (as proposed in S.4234-A & A.4055-A)
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to the finality of certain utility charges and the contents of utility bills; and to amend a chapter of the laws of 2023 amending the public service law relating to the finality of certain utility charges and the contents of utility bills, as proposed in legislative bills numbers S. 4234-A and A. 4055-A, in relation to the effectiveness thereof
